name: Lingwei Chen
content: Lingwei Chen, Ph.D. Lingwei Chen, Ph.D. Assistant Professor GOL-3701 RIT Rochester, NY lwcics[at]rit.edu Google Scholar DBLP I am currently a tenure-track Assistant Professor in the Golisano College of Computing and Information Sciences at Rochester Institute of Technology. Prior to that, I worked as an Assistant Professor at Wright State University and a Postdoctoral Scholar at the Pennsylvania State University. I received my Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from West Virginia University advised by Prof. Yanfang (Fanny) Ye (University of Notre Dame), and my master's degree in Computer Science from Beijing Normal University. My research interests are machine learning and security, with emphases in: Trustworthy machine learning: adversarial attacks and defenses, adversary for social good, model explanations, other trustworthy issues Cybersecurity with ML/AI: detecting security attacks (e.g., malware, fraud, bot, phishing, vulnerability) with a focus on challenging data scenarios (e.g., few-shot learning, class imbalance, heterophilic structures) using graph neural networks and language models Data mining and science: real-world applications in IoT, social networks, bioinformatics, education, information retrieval, and others For my publications and bibliometrics, please refer to Publications and Google Scholar. Openings: I am looking for self-motivated Ph.D. students to work with me on various cool projects. Please drop me an email with your CV if interested.
